revised_title: The Physics of Cricket Ball Swing in Flight
tldr: This study investigates the transverse aerodynamic forces on cricket balls in flight, focusing on the role of the ball's seam and boundary layer separation. The experiments show that a prominent seam inclined at a slight angle to the direction of projection, along with a smooth surface and a small amount of back-spin, can cause the ball to swing. The phenomenon is influenced by transient effects, leading to variations in swing even with new balls.
